newsitem.title: KUWAIT: Kuwait court drops case against former minister.
newsitem.headline: Kuwait court drops case against former minister.

text.p: A Kuwaiti court on Tuesday dropped a fraud case involving former oil minister Sheikh Ali al-Khalifa al-Sabah in response to a request by defence lawyers who cited procedural flaws, lawyers and judicial sources said.
"The ministers' court has accepted the request by the defence lawyers of Sheikh Ali al-Khalifa, which says the court has no jurisdiction over the case," one source said.
Sheikh Ali, who faced charges of making illegal profits from the operations of the state-owned Kuwait Oil Tanker Co (KOTC) in the 1980s, denies any wrongdoing.
"From what I can see, today's ruling means the case does not exist," said a lawyer, who noted that a detailed version of the ruling would be issued later.
Sheikh Ali's lawyers have repeatedly said the case was invalid because of what they called mistakes by the prosecution and a criminal court that previously handled the case.
The criminal court and the so-called ministers' court were locked in technical arguments about procedures that led to the trial, which has lasted for more than three years.

Sheikh Ali, chief architect of Kuwait's worldwide oil empire, is one of the most prominent members of the Sabah family to be tried in a criminal court and is believed to be the only former minister to be tried for offences related to his duties.
